title: Katie Price 'discovers her daughter Princess' pet hedgehog two weeks after she lost it'
text:
Katie Price has reunited her daughter Princess with her pet hedgehog Peggy after losing it two weeks ago in her 'mucky mansion'.

The former glamour model, 41, first revealed that the creature had gone missing when she gave her YouTube followers a tour around her home.

While showing off her sprawling property and revealing rooms that were covered with piles of clothes, Katie admitted Princess' pet was nowhere to be found.

Back together: Katie Price has reunited her daughter Princess with her pet hedgehog Peggy after losing it two weeks ago in her 'mucky mansion'

However a source revealed to the Sun that Katie has since discovered the pet in her property, saying: 'Peggy is back - Katie always knew she'd find her again.'

The TV personality first shared a glimpse of Peggy back in January, when she shared a snap of Princess cradling the spiky animal on her lap.

Katie previously gave fans an inside look at her £2 million West Sussex mansion, and horrified fans with the mess of her property.

It comes after the work on Katie Price's sprawling mansion ground to a halt after it was reported she was facing a £20,000 fine for failing to get planning permission for the renovation works.

Reunited: The former glamour model, 41, first revealed that the creature had gone missing when she gave her YouTube followers a tour around her home

During the tour, Katie took fans around her large mansion which revealed rooms that were filled to the brim with suitcases and piles of clothes.

In one shot the walls were clearly covered with crayon scribbles and drawings, presumably from her two young children.

The mother-of-five admitted she was in desperate need of a clear-out in her wardrobe, before pulling out various pieces of underwear and dresses.

So much stuff: The former glamour model, 41, posted a tour of the sprawling property on her Youtube channel, revealing rooms that were covered with piles of clothes

Katie also told her followers that her clear-out is part of a much bigger transformation, but remained tight-lipped about the outcome.

Hearkening back to her glamour model days, Katie pulled out a racy pants before telling the two cleaners she hired: 'Would you think I'm boring in bed looking at all this?'

While one responded with 'hell no,' Katie added: 'I'm so b****y boring. I just love stockings and suspenders. I love it.'

Big plans: Katie also told her followers that her clear-out is part of a much bigger transformation, but remained tight-lipped about the outcome

As they rummaged through the piles, Katie told her cleaners: 'I tell you what I do need - Jett and Bunny's pants and socks.'

She moaned: 'It's an absolute headache. Most of these I'll put on eBay. Where do I start?'

'My plan is I've got to go in each room, find what I want and what I don't want. I've been putting stuff on eBay for years but I do have to sort this out.'

Katie added: 'The place is literally full of junk. You know when someone's got a garage full of c**p? I've got nine.'

Dirty: Noting the clutter in her home, Katie said in the video: 'The place is literally full of junk. You know when someone's got a garage full of c**p? I've got nine'

No more work: It comes following reports that the renovations on Katie's mansion had ground to a halt, as the builders have left the property after just four months

It comes following reports that the renovations on Katie's mansion had ground to a halt, as the builders have left the property after just four months.

A source told The Sun: 'The building work has stopped and the builders have left. Katie's in a terrible position - she's got nowhere to live and the house is in a worse state than before.

'She can't pay anyone else to take it on because she doesn't have the money before the bankruptcy hearing next month - and she can't move back in. It's a complete state inside.'

A representative for Katie Price declined to comment when contacted by MailOnline.

Controversial: In August it was reported that Katie was being fined £20,000 for failing to get planning permission for the works on her house

In August it was reported that Katie was being fined £20,000 for failing to get planning permission for the works on her house.

After a three week investigation, planning enforcement offices concluded that the development was a 'breach of planning control' and issued a temporary stop notice to stop the development from continuing. Katie will be able to continue with the renovations if she gets permission.

Documents reveal that Katie undertook various engineering works to change the height of the land at her property as well as creating an entrance at the southern end of her property.

A mess: A source said: ''She can't pay anyone else to take it on because she doesn't have the money before the bankruptcy hearing next month - and she can't move back in'

Drama: The source added: 'Katie's in a terrible position - she's got nowhere to live and the house is in a worse state than before' (the house pictured above in August)

In planning documents, Horsham District Council concluded: 'The council considers that there has been a breach of planning control.

'This temporary stop is issued by the council, in exercise of their power in Section 17E of the 1990 Town and Country Planning Act because they think that it is expedient that the activity specified in this notice should cease.

'The alleged unauthorised development would have an adverse impact on the character and appearance of the area.'

If the 2015 CBB winner ignores the stop notice, the council say that she may be at risk of immediate prosecution in Magistrates Court and be ordered to pay up to £20,000 in fines.

She was once said to be worth £40 million from a career as a model, author, and businesswoman.
description: Katie Price has reunited her daughter Princess with her pet hedgehog Peggy after losing it two weeks ago in her 'mucky mansion'.
